suncertify.client

Class BrokerClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • suncertify.client.BrokerClient
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BrokerLocalClient, BrokerRemoteClient

    public abstract class BrokerClient
extends java.lang.Object
    The BrokerClient class is the abstract baseclass for all the client types in the application. It also servers as a factory for the creation of the different client types.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Augustine Ogundimu
    See Also:
    BrokerLocalClient, BrokerRemoteClient

      private class  BrokerClient.ClientDialogThread
      The ClientDialogThread implements the Runnable inteface.

      • condition

        private java.util.concurrent.locks.Condition condition
        This is a reference to a Condition object used for synchronization during the client startup process.
        See Also:
        Condition, getClientConfigParams(AppRunMode)

      • clientStarted

        protected boolean clientStarted
        This value indicates whether the client had been started or not. It is used during client shutdown to determine what course of action to take.
        See Also:
        startClient(), stopClient(), BrokerLocalClient.startClient(), BrokerRemoteClient.startClient(), BrokerLocalClient.stopClient(), BrokerRemoteClient.stopClient()

      • clientGUI

        protected BrokerAppClientGUI clientGUI
        This is a reference to a BrokerAppClientGUI object. This class implements all main application GUI.
        See Also:
        BrokerAppClientGUI

      • controller

        protected ClientController controller
        This is a reference to a ClientController object. This acts as the controller for this client.
        See Also:
        ClientController

      • clientId

        protected int clientId
        This is the integer value uniquely identifying this client from the the perspective of the server. This value is returned from the server when the client registers for model update notifications.
        See Also:
        startClient(), BrokerLocalClient.startClient(), BrokerRemoteClient.startClient()

    • Constructor Detail

      • BrokerClient

        public BrokerClient()

    • Method Detail

      • getClient

        public static BrokerClient getClient(AppRunMode runMode)
                              throws BrokerClientException
        This method returns a reference to a BrokerClient object depending on the runMode parameter. The client can be run in two modes
        • STAND_ALONE - The client and the server are running in the same JVM
        • NETWORK_CLIENT - The client and the server are in separate JVMs; they may or may not be running on different machines.
        Parameters:
        runMode - The runMode parameter indicates the type of client object that should be returned.
        Returns:
        A reference to a BrokerClient object, the concrete type depends on the runMode parameter
        Throws:
        BrokerClientException - if the wrong mode is specified.
        See Also:
        AppRunMode

      • getClientConfigParams

        protected void getClientConfigParams(AppRunMode mode)
        This method creates the client dialog configuration GUI and then blocks until the user has entered the appropriate configuration parameters in the dialog. This method is called during the client startup process.
        Parameters:
        mode - The specifies the client run mode for the client
        See Also:
        AppRunMode, BrokerClient.ClientDialogThread, BrokerLocalClient.startClient(), BrokerRemoteClient.startClient()

      • startClient

        public void startClient()
                 throws BrokerClientException
        This method creates an instance of a ClientCleanupThread object and registers it with the JVM. This ensures that appropriate cleanup steps are taken when the client crashes or exits.

        The subclasses of this class override this method, but calls are made to this baseclass version of this method to ensure registration of the cleanup thread with the JVM.

        Throws:
        BrokerClientException - when errors are encountered in the client startup process.
        See Also:
        BrokerLocalClient.startClient(), BrokerRemoteClient.startClient()

      • stopClient

        public abstract void stopClient()
                         throws BrokerClientException
        This method implements the client shutdown process.
        Throws:
        BrokerClientException - when erros are encountered in the client shutdown process.
        See Also:
        BrokerLocalClient.stopClient(), BrokerRemoteClient.stopClient()

      • notifyUpdate

        public void notifyUpdate()
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method is the callback for receiving notifications of DB updates. The client registers with the DB server at startup time in order to these notifications.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is any communication error during a call to this method.
        See Also:
        BrokerLocalClient.startClient(), BrokerRemoteClient.startClient()
